gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19115-2 Geographic Information - Metadata - Part 2: Extensions for Imagery and Gridded Data

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Physical, chemical, and biological water quality data collected from a small boat in western Lake Erie, Great Lakes from 2019-04-30 to 2019-10-07

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: US DOC; NOAA; OAR; Great Lakes Environmental Research Laboratory (Great Lakes Environmental Research Laboratory - GLERL)
US DOC; NOAA; OAR; Great Lakes Environmental Research Laboratory (Great Lakes Environmental Research Laboratory - GLERL)
Cooperative Institute for Great Lakes Research (CIGLR - University of Michigan)

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Physical, chemical, and biological water quality data from the western basin of Lake Erie collected during 2019. These data were collected during repeated trips to a set of stations before, during, and after harmful algal blooms (HABs). Data for the following parameters are included, wind speed, wave height, secchi depth, CTD temperature, CTD specific conductivity, CTD beam attenuation, CTD transmission, CTD dissolved oxygen, CTD phytosynthetically active radiation, turbidity, particulate microcystin, dissolved microsystin, extracted phycocyanin, extracted phycocyanin, extracted chlorophyll-a, total phosphorous, total dissolved phosphorous, soluble reactive phosphorus, ammonia, nitrate + nitrite, particulate organic carbon, particulate organic nitrogen, colored dissolved organic material absorbance at 400 nm, total suspended solids, and volatile suspended solids. Table cells with no value means no data available.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: These data were collected by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration Great Lakes Environmental Research Laboratory (NOAA-GLERL) and the Cooperative Institute for Great Lakes Research (CIGLR) (NOAA Cooperative Agreement NA17OAR4320152) to support NOAA-GLERL’s operational development of the Lake Erie harmful algal bloom (HAB) forecasts and to directly monitor microcystin concentrations within the ecosystem. We have conducted this discrete field sampling along with continuous field sampling, experimental work, and hydrodynamic-biological mechanistic modeling to ensure development of useful tools and technology for local managers, interfacing with end users- facilitating the translation of research into more effective decision-making and public education.

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Related Funding Agency: US Environmental Protection Agency (US EPA - US EPA)

Suggested Author List: Burtner, Ashley; Kitchens, Christine; Fyffe, Deanna; Godwin, Casey; Johengen, Tom; Stuart, Dack; Cooperative Institute for Great Lakes Research, University of Michigan; Errera, Reagan; Palladino, Danna; Fanslow, David; Gossiaux, Duane; National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, Great Lakes Environmental Research Laboratory

gmd:keyword.gmx:Anchor: colored dissolved organic material absorbance at 400nm

RADIATION - PHOTOSYNTHETICALLY ACTIVE [PHOTOSYNTHETIC ACTIVE RADIATION (PAR)] (micro Einsteins per meter^2 per second)
colored dissolved organic material absorbance at 400nm (meter^-1)
